duties_responsibilities.duty: Prepare, season, cook, and plate all hot food for cafeteria, patients, and catered events using standardized recipes while maintaining strict food safety and sanitation standards.
Review menus and work orders to determine the type and quantities of food to be prepared for patients, cafeteria, and catered functions.
Plan cooking schedules so foods will be ready at specified times.
Confers with Production Manager/Executive Chef regarding modified diet prep and use of leftovers.
Procure foodstuffs from the refrigerator, freezer, or other storage areas.
Wash, trim, season, cook, measure, and mix food according to recipes and Production Manager/Executive Chef instructions.
Use a variety of kitchen utensils and equipment such as mixers, grinders, etc.
Utilize steamers, kettles, tilting skillets, conventional ovens, grills, fryers, and blast chillers in cooking, cooling, and preparation of food.
Adjust heat control and timers on stoves, ovens, steam kettles, and grills according to instructions.
Carve portions of meat, fish, fowl for individual servings.
Assist in platting and lidding portioned foods.
Maintain strict sanitary standards according to departmental policies and procedures, handling food appropriately, maintaining temperatures, cleaning workstations, etc.
Follow HACCP methods for storing, cooking, preparing, and cooling potentially hazardous foods.
Provide customer service with a respectful, flexible, knowledgeable, confident, professional, pleasant attitude, and be patient and helpful.

education_certification.credential: High School Diploma or equivalent graduation from a formal technical school specializing in hotel or institutional cooking
